comments:
Every once and while I've seen this internal error (with an error dialog):

An internal error occurred running "Spanish Flu Middlesex USA 10, ZZZ (-1, 0, 1, 2) Full infrastructure, Spanish Flu (deterministic_seir), Aggregating SEIR Human  (aggregatingseir)".

With the following exception reported in the error log.

java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.core.model.impl.DecoratorImpl.decorateGraph(DecoratorImpl.java:137)
at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.core.scenario.impl.ScenarioImpl.initialize(ScenarioImpl.java:329)
at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.core.scenario.impl.ScenarioImpl.step(ScenarioImpl.java:239)
at org.eclipse.ohf.stem.jobs.simulation.Simulation.run(Simulation.java:239)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

It seems to occur when the system is first started.
I wasn't able to reproduce this error.  It seems to occur occasionally and at random.  I did add an error message that reports the name of the decorator before the exception is thrown.
I saw this again, but the title was printed as "null".  I added the type of the decorator to the error message.
I saw this happening several times today, but during a single session. I could not reproduce it afterwards. The exception is thrown, but everything seems to keep working fine.
